org.jtrim2.event

Interface ListenerRegistry<ListenerType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ListenerType - the type of the event listeners can possibly be added to the container
    All Superinterfaces:
    SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListenerManager<ListenerType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CopyOnTriggerListenerManager, OneShotListenerManager

    public interface ListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
extends SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
    Defines a collection of event listeners which can be notified of events in an implementation dependent way. This interface extends SimpleListenerRegistry allowing to return the number of currently registered listeners. Since the number of added listeners is rarely needed, you should consider relying on the SimpleListenerRegistry interface because it is not always simple to return the number of registered listeners.

    Thread safety

    Implementations of this interface are required to be safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Implementations of the methods of this interface must be synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    ListenerManager, CopyOnTriggerListenerManager

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getListenerCount()
      Returns the number of currently added but not yet removed listeners.
      ListenerRef registerListener(ListenerType listener)
      Adds an event listener to this container and returns a reference which can later be used to removed the listener added.

    • Method Detail

      • registerListener

        ListenerRef registerListener(ListenerType listener)
        Adds an event listener to this container and returns a reference which can later be used to removed the listener added.

        Subsequent event notifications will notify the added listener unless it is removed using the returned reference.

        It doesn't matter if the listener was already added. In case the given listener have been added to this ListenerRegistry it will be added again causing the added listener to be notified as many times as it has been added. Note that the equals method of the listener should have no effect regarding this ListenerRegistry.

        If a listener is removed but it was added multiple times, it will be removed only once. So, further event notifications will be delivered to the listener one less time.

        Specified by:
        registerListener in interface SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be added to this container and be notified in subsequent event notifications method calls. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the reference which can be used to remove the currently added listener. This method never returns null.

      • getListenerCount

        int getListenerCount()
        Returns the number of currently added but not yet removed listeners.
        Returns:
        the number of currently added but not yet removed listeners. This method always returns an integer greater than or equal to zero.
